name: Lemon Tree Hotel City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our way out of Delhi after a month travelling. It was a pleasant surprise on the inside (considering the outside). There is a lot of building work going on around this place and it doesn't really look like a place you can wander around outside either during the day or at night.
reviews.title: Great place to wait for a flight - 1 to 2 days perhaps

reviews.text: This hotel is a place to wait for a flight and it is a nice place to do it.
reviews.title: great location
More a Budget Hotel!
reviews.text: It has a good bar and restaurant serving indian and some good western meals. The rooms were small but cosy. Cleanliness was fantastic and the bed very comfortable.

I would recommend this hotel to anybody wanting to hold up for 1 or 2 days and who doesn't want to use it as a base for sightseeing. It costs around RS1000 to the airport from here. They have internet facilities and the staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Good and clean

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the Delhi Airport, offers comfortable rooms at reasonable rates. Close to NH8. offers Indian / continental food... Indian food is very good.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, just not a launch pad for Delhi

reviews.text: The theme of the hotel appears to want to portray a business approach with a bit of light hearted humour from the placemats in the restaurant and idioms on the walls, (even in the reception toilets).
reviews.title: A typical business hotel

reviews.text: The staff are attentive and by the second day on my first visit knew my name and room number and were always trying to ensure I was happy. Now I am viewed as part of the furniture.
reviews.title: Clean Efficient Business Hotel
Basic hotel
reviews.text: Room sizes vary but are mainly clean and tidy, a lot of variety on the tv and most have a mini-bar and some even have a microwave. Try to get a external view, although not much to write home about, is far better than the view of the restaurant. The 'Citrus' restaurant is good and you can definately find something to eat considerng the price of the food and is open 24hrs. The 'Slounge' bar is ok to unwind after a day being thrown around on the roads of India, not fond of the complimentary bowl of chick-pea, (bring back the nuts and crisps).
A downside of the hotel is the lack of meeting areas, as the bar doesn't open until 5.30pm so you have to go out elsewhere.
reviews.title: Cramped rooms

reviews.text: They have their own drivers to take you into town, and you can hire them for half a day or full day or use them purely as a taxi service, weigh up the costs first. Be sure to get the driver's mobile phone number!! There are security guards patrolling 24 hours due to the amount of building work.
reviews.title: Hated the hotel

reviews.text: Good service with attention to details from original booking on the Internet, arrival at the hotel, having the business meetings and use of the hotel conference hall. It was a pleasure to have spent the whole week, along with my colleagues from USA and UK.
reviews.title: Excellent value for a comfortable stay and business meetings

reviews.text: The Hotel is clean inside and the english jokes around the walls made me lighter. Smiling english speaking people around to assist you in everything. Good coffee made my day. Good place to stay. All hotel around in the city very expensive.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel

reviews.text: I checked-in to the hotel and had been traveling for the past one month. i called up room service and asked weather they would be able to make some homely food for me and bang on at 11 in the night.
reviews.title: You can depend on their service

reviews.text: stayed there for 3 nights and overall was a great experience
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: I was a single traveller, the hotel team took lot of intreast in inviting me for the diwali celebration the hotel was lit up and the hotel staff and couple of people staying at the hotel enjoyed crackers at the parking area of the hotel. I really enjoyed my stay. Thank youhotel team for making my Diwali a great one.
reviews.title: Business Hotel With Great Staff

reviews.text: I travel to Delhi on work quite a few times and have stayed at The Lemon Tree, Gurgaon since it is close to DLF city where my office is.
reviews.title: FUnctional Rooms

reviews.text: The rooms are neat and clean. There is internet connectivity available in the rooms for a price. I stayed in a single room studio which seemed to be a bit small for my liking.
reviews.title: Small rooms

reviews.text: The food is pretty good though the options are limited. Whatever is available is very good.
reviews.title: The ambeince is great but the rooms are small

reviews.text: The breakfast also has limited option, the South indian fare is passable but the North Indian is very good.
reviews.title: Small but nice biz hotel

reviews.text: Its location is a bit inside and you really need to be sure how to get there. Once there, it is quite peaceful.
reviews.title: good Hotel with no problems

description: Located in the Millennium City Center of Gurgaon (Sector 29, HUDA) and close to the expressway (NH 8), this bright and airy hotel is in close proximity to Signature Towers, Unitech Business Park and Unitech Trade Center.
